plot: Del is hoping to sell a load of wigs bought from Mustapha to the old ladies in the Nag's Head and is annoyed to find out that he has actually bought a box of mens' wigs. Cassandra leaves Rodney, claiming that he lacks drive. He turns vegetarian and sports a clip-on pony-tail to appear trendy but when Cassandra gets back in touch with him she tells him she prefers him just as he is. Raquel gives birth to a baby boy, which Rodney has jokingly suggested be called Damien, a name Del and Raquel are happy to give him. As dusk falls Del communes with his dead mother to tell her of his happiness.—don @ minifie-1

Rodney is feeling depressed about his latest meeting with Cassandra, but cheers up when he learns about Del's hair-brained scheme - a consignment of dodgy wigs. Raquel is due to give birth very soon, and the bets are on at the Nag's Head as to whether the new addition to the Trotter household will be a boy or a girl, and as to what his or her name might be. Meanwhile, Rodney is convinced all this could be a bad 'omen'...—stevecann2003
